==Trivia==
* The Chinese, Japanese, and Russian versions of the name use "Goethe" instead of "Goth."
** It may have been inspired by the fact that Germany has numerous places and organizations named after the poet {{w|Johann Wolfgang von Goethe}} (notably {{w|Goethe University Frankfurt}}, the {{w|Goethe-Institut}}, and the {{w|Goethe House}}).<ref>German Wikipedia: {{w|de:Kategorie:Johann Wolfgang von Goethe als Namensgeber|Kategorie:Johann Wolfgang von Goethe als Namensgeber}}</ref>
** "Goethe Hotel" and "Hotel Goethe" do in fact seem to be popular names for hotels in Germany and exist at least in Cologne, Frankfurt, Munich, Ottweiler, Staufen im Breisgau, and Wetzlar.
** This name is also used by two locations in miHoYo's other game title, Honkai: Star Rail's [[w:c:honkai-star-rail:Goethe Hotel|Goethe Hotel]] and [[w:c:honkai-star-rail:Goethe Grand Hotel|Goethe Grand Hotel]].
* The sign that hangs next to the left of the entrance reads "Inn" in what is likely the [[Language#Mondstadt Script|Mondstadt script]] instead of the [[Teyvat Script]]. Like other signs, this sign only faces one way; looking at the sign from the other side shows the text in reverse ("nnI").
